column2: OHIO DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
column8: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 2. This road sign means:
3. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 4. This sign means:
5. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column6: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column8: there is a right turn ahead.

column2: 6. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 7. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
8. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 9. This sign warns that:
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 11. The picture shows a _________ sign.
12. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column10: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.

column2: 13. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
14. The picture shows:
15. This is:
16. The octagonal shape is used:
column6: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column10: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 17. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 19. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column10: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
21. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column10: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 22. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column8: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 23. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to know when it is safe to cross.
column6: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column8: to suddenly run into the street.
column10: not to cross unless they are with an adult.

column2: 24. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
25. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 26. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column8: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column10: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.

column2: 27. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column6: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column10: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 28. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 29. A flashing yellow light means:
30. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column8: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 31. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column6: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 32. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
33. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column8: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 34. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column6: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column8: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column10: has the same meaning as a yield sign.

column2: 35. Parking is not allowed:
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 36. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 37. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 38. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
39. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 40. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column8: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
